thread.title: Bets Placed Ahead Of NDSU vs. SDSU Game
thread.title_full: Bets Placed Ahead Of NDSU vs. SDSU Game

title: Bets Placed Ahead Of NDSU vs. SDSU Game
text:
Bets Placed Ahead Of NDSU vs. SDSU Game October 3, 2015, 5:59 AM BROOKINGS, SD - 
There's a lot riding on Saturday's big game between SDSU and NDSU. 
South Dakota and North Dakota's Governors were the first to get in on the action. They're betting $100. The money will go to the winner's charity of choice. 
Senator John Thune of South Dakota announced he's placed a friendly wager on the football game. If the Jackrabbits win, North Dakota Senator John Hoeven will give bison steaks to Thune. If the bison win, Thune will give meats and cheeses to Hoeven. 
The university presidents also placed a bet. The winner will send a team jersey to the loser. 
And last, but not least, there's the Dakota Marker. 
Kickoff is Saturday at 6 p.m. in Brookings. Tickets are sold out, so with the new, larger stadium there will be a record crowd. 
If you are there, send us pictures of the action. Share your pictures and videos with us by emailing ushare@keloland.com ; submitting a photo using the KELOLAND News App ; upload it to the uShare Photo Gallery ; or use #kelosports when you post on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram.
